Package Lists

Class LinkedList

java.lang.Object
Lists.LinkedList
public class LinkedList
extends java.lang.Object
The LinkedList class is a doubly linked list that holds pointers to a head and a tail node. The Node contains an Object and pointers to a next and previous Node to link the list. Functions to manipulate the LinkedList are Append(Node), Prepend(Node), InsertAfter(Node, Node), Remove(Node). Functions to read the Object data from the LinkedList are an overloaded toString().

    • Append

      public void Append​(LinkedList.Node n)

      Parameters:
      n - is the Node to be appended to the ArrayList.

      Parameters:

    • InsertAfter

      public void InsertAfter​(LinkedList.Node before, LinkedList.Node after)
      Add a Node to the LinkedList after a chosen Node.
      Parameters:
      before - is the Node that the inserted node will be inserted after.
      after - is the Node to be inserted to the LinkedList.

    • Remove

      public void Remove​(LinkedList.Node n)
      Remove a Node from the LinkedList if it exists.
      Parameters:
      n - is the Node to be removed to the ArrayList.
